snippet: Two officers may become the first women to graduate from Ranger School. For now, though, they are not allowed to try out for the Ranger regiment.
abstract: Attempt by two women to graduate from Army's Ranger School, its top leadership course, is being watched closely as armed services considers which combat roles will remain off limits to women; services have until January 1 to decide; 17 other women have dropped out of Ranger course, which was previously only available to men.
lead_paragraph: Two officers may become the first women to graduate from Ranger School. For now, though, they are not allowed to try out for the Ranger regiment.

headline.main: Army Ranger School a Test for Women in Combat Roles
headline.print_headline: Army Ranger School Seen as Test for Women in Combat

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
